department: DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC WORKS AND GOVERNMENT SERVICES
short_summary: REQUEST FOR STANDING OFFER FOR HYDRAULIC REPAIR SERVICES
description: The Department of Public Works and Government Services, on behalf of Fisheries and Oceans Canada – Canadian Coast Guard, is issuing this Request for Standing Offer for the acquisition of any necessary repair services and spare parts for hydraulic/pneumatic power systems on all Vessels in the Fisheries and Oceans Canada – Canadian Coast Guard, Central and Arctic Region, St. Lawrence and Great Lake sector, on an as-and-when-requested basis, located in Quebec and Ontario, as detailed in Annex A.
duration_in_months: Our records indicate an approximate duration of 6 months after contract award.
tags: Water transport vessel maintenance and repair services
full_summary:
## Tender Announcement: Standing Offer for Hydraulic Repair Services

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) invites vendors to submit a Request for Standing Offer (RSO) for the provision of hydraulic repair services.

* **Tender Reference**: WS4467315545-Doc4546662397
* **Publication Date** : 25 April 2024
* **Tender Closing Date** : 15 May 2024, 14:00 (Eastern Standard Time)
* **Expected Contract Start Date**: 1 June 2024

## Description of Requirements
The services contract will be used to acquire repair services and spare parts for hydraulic and pneumatic power systems on Fisheries and Oceans Canada’s - Canadian Coast Guard vessels located in Quebec and Ontario. The contract will be used on an as-and-when-requested basis.

* **Location of Works**: Quebec (except National Capital Region) and Ontario (except National Capital Region)
* **Nature of Work**: Hydraulic repair services and spare parts for power systems on vessels

## Selection Criteria
The lowest bidder will be selected for the contract.

## Trade Agreements
This tender is open to vendors who can demonstrate compliance with trade agreements, including the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

## Contact Information
* **Vendor Contact**: Phan, Stephen (PSPC/SPAC)
* **Email**: [stephen.phan@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:stephen.phan@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)
* **Website**: https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/19520094?extsite=MTk1MjAwOTRfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==
